alert.note: Alert for Dawes; North Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 5:12PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Dawes and northeastern Sioux Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Fort Robinson Campground, or 27 miles west of Chadron, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Dawes and northeastern Sioux Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
